Posts.Content: Hi, I'm on 3rd cycle of 6 FEC, I used the cold cao for the first 2 but started loosing gobbets of hair after the second. To such an extent I looked like a VERY devout monk! Always thought that this would be the hardest thing for me but found when the time came I was totally up for shaving it all of as it couldn't be worse than the wisps I had left. I've had nothing but positive comments, a lovely wig if I feel the need and great scarves... Which by the way make you look tots glam! Theirs always a silver lining if you look hard enough. Xx
Posts.Title: hair starting to go :-(

Posts.Content: Hi lisa88, if you take paracetamol you need to take your temperature first as you don't want it to mask a temperature which might indicate an infection. Also your toothbrush should be soft, or even extra soft. I've seen on some other threads that it has been recommended to change your toothbrush for each cycle. Some people have also suggested sucking on ice pops or ice lollies, bought or home made during the chemo to try and prevent mouth ulcers. I think, on the principle of the cold cap! Hope this helps xx Penny
